219. Downing, Etta May (Mrs. Lorne E.)

219. Downing, Etta May (Mrs. Lorne E.)
3. **SUGAR AND SYRUPS**

In what quantity did you buy "white sugar"?  
That was the price. For a ten pound sack of this or another?  
That brand of golden corn syrup did you use?  
At what price?

4. **DAIRY PRODUCTS**

Did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?  
Butter?  
That was the price of butter?  
Did you make eggs for dinner?  
Did you make butter?  
What kind of cheese?

5. **MEAT AND FISH**

What was your meat supply in the early years?  
How often did you get fresh meat?  
For how long?  
Was there a "meat ring" in your neighborhood?  
It so that year was it organized?  
Did you use names?  
For how long?  
What part did fish play in the family diet?  
Was the fish fresh, cured, or canned?

**Notes:**
3. SUGAR AND SPICES

In what quantity did you buy "sugar" recently?

What was the price for a "can" (pound) of sugar?

That brand of golden corn syrup did you use?

That also of tea or coffee did you usually buy?

At what price?

4. DAIRY PRODUCTS

How did you get a supply of fresh milk in the early days?

Butter?

That was the price of butter?

Did you make butter?

Did you make cheese?

What kind of cheese?

5. MEAT AND FISH

What was your meat supply in the early years?

How did you get fresh meat?

How often did you eat fresh meat?

How did you preserve meat?

Was there a "meat ring" in your neighborhood around 1916?

If so, what year was it organized?

Did you use peas?

For how long?

What part did fish play in the family diet?

Was the fish fresh, canned, or smoked?

Where?
6. NEW MILLS AND SUGAR PLANTS

What kind of tea did you buy? Black, Green, or Oolong?
What kind of coffee did you buy? (beans or ground) Regular, Decaf, French Press?
Price? $3.50

7. VEGETABLES AND FRUITS

What was the price of potatoes per bushel? Then you put up housekeeping? Yes/No

Could you get potatoes at the store?

If not, where from?

What year did you first grow your own supply for the winter of:

Potatoes 1912
Carrots 1912
Onions 1912
Turnips 1912
Cabbage 1912
Beets 1912

In what quantities did you buy white navy beans?

How did you buy prunes (in bulk or by the box)?

That weight?

How did you buy prunes (in bulk or by the box)?

That weight?

That was the price of prunes?

That other dried fruit did you use in the earliest days? (apricots, peaches, apricots, peaches, loganberries, raisins, currants or others?)

8. PRESERVING

In the early years, how did you keep food by canning?

That year did you first preserve fruit by canning?

That year did you first preserve vegetables by canning?

That year did you first preserve meat by canning?

Do you still preserve foods by canning or drying?

To that extent, do you make your own vinegar?

Did you make your own wine?

12. WATER SUPPLY

There did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (Well, river, stream, dugout)

If so, was this water from your house?

How was it brought to the house? (Well, barrel, tank)

Was there any other supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started homesteading, starting dates where possible.

Land new and old.
13. SAVES

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Bought.

If you made your own, did you use lye? Yes.

What kind of laundry soap did the nearest market sell?

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? Wood - Coal.

Have you used any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping? (Specify dates where possible.)

Last year you heated with fuel oil. Purpose:

15. HEATERS & COOKING UTENSILS

For cooking, did you use an indoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest days? (Give dates) Yes.

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) No.

By whom was your first cook stove made? (Name)

That year was it purchased? (Year)

What type of utensils did you use? (Iron, copper, tin, homemade)

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other)

When did you first use aluminum? (Year)

Have been in here about 1915
13. NAME

DID YOU BY FAMILY GROUP OR BY PERSON?

ASKED:

If you were in the army or navy during World War I, what kind of laundry work did you do? (Wood - Coal)

What food did you use in our last days? (There was no meat)

There did you get your fuel? (River - For wood - Coal - Maple Creek - 90 miles)

Has there been any change in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping? (River - Lumber - Hardwood)

Last year you had with fuel Oil + purpose gas.

14. RESULTS OF HOUSEHOLD SURVEY

For cooking, did you use an outdoor fireplace or open hearth in the earliest home days? (Give dates) ...ha...

Did you use an outdoor fireplace or bake oven? (Give dates) ...no...

By whom was your first cook stove bought? (Give name)

That year was it purchased? ...1915

What types of utensils did you use? (Iron, copper, tin, glass, porcelain)

For preparing food? (china, earthenware, wooden bowls, other)

When did you start using aluminum? ...not think so

Have been in use about 1915
17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the enlisted man you can remember. Give the name and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the occupation of mother, etc., father or others.

18. What was your first Christmas dinner in eastern Canada? Approximately how many people attended?

19. Have you ever refused to accept standard issue food rations? If so, what?
17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the end of last year when you were living in the house. Include any special occasions or holidays.

18. What will you serve for your first Christmas dinner in sixteen years? Include the menu, list those present and their ages at that time.

19. How did you feel about the changes in the house over the past year?

20. What do you think will happen next year?
20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earlier days compared with today.

Better now and then. Better now and then. Better now and then.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and less prepared foods? (Give as many details as possible.)

I have never grown up caring for our own food.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other pioneer times in northern Nevada.

This saved the cost of handling as it made the supplies a lot cheaper than store.
21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of home grown and home prepared foods? (Give an example of each.)

Better stove and utensils now and then.

Little method of cooking.

Can't and transportation.

More variety—faster.

I have never grown any vegetables.

Fruit and game and puddings.

For our own use.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and storing foods in other towns, smaller pioneer farms in Eastern Canada, or elsewhere. Include any unusual storage devices used, other details. Use back of paper if needed.

Very hard road over the west maple creek

90 miles across country to the river to be delayed

feed and then be brought back supplies.

This saved the cost of handling as it made the supplies a lot cheaper than the store.
